block.p: LEAD: He came up for a cup of coffee, and his performance was good to the last drop, but all Mike York has to show for it after one game with the Pittsburgh Pirates is an empty cup and an impressive line in the record book: seven shutout innings and a 7-1 victory over the Reds in Cincinnati.

LEAD: He came up for a cup of coffee, and his performance was good to the last drop, but all Mike York has to show for it after one game with the Pittsburgh Pirates is an empty cup and an impressive line in the record book: seven shutout innings and a 7-1 victory over the Reds in Cincinnati.

He came up for a cup of coffee, and his performance was good to the last drop, but all Mike York has to show for it after one game with the Pittsburgh Pirates is an empty cup and an impressive line in the record book: seven shutout innings and a 7-1 victory over the Reds in Cincinnati.

York, who was called up from the Pirates' Buffalo farm club to take some pressure off the Pittsburgh pitching staff during a spate of doubleheaders, gave up six hits but no runs in the first game of a doubleheader Friday night. The outing was good enough to prompt Manager Jim Leyland to reconsider, but not ultimatelty to alter, his plans to use the 25-year-old pitcher for just one game and then to recall Orlando Merced, a first baseman and oufielder who appeared in 17 games for the Pirates before being sent to Buffalo on July 25.
York was sent back to Buffalo yesterday, but is not expected to mope. He's getting married there tomorrow night. (AP) SPORTS PEOPLE
